title: Facing issue when load .pkl in new environment , NameError: name 'target_inverse_transformer' is not defined

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
For my streamlit app , used only .pkl output from pycaret. when I loaded and run the app, got error

name 'target_inverse_transformer' is not defined. 2 months back I used same code It was working .

but when I loaded the pkl file in the  same notebook where I created model, it is fine . 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18657211/91666585-984c4100-eb1b-11ea-9a9a-a4cd78f754fd.png)

title: Compare models MLFlowException
body:
Hi. I just upgraded to pycaret 2.1. When I ran the compare_models function with the Titanic dataset, I got the following error:

MlflowException: Unable to map 'np.object' type to MLflow DataType. np.object canbe mapped iff all values have identical data type which is one of (string, (bytes or byterray),  int, float)

The same code worked fine in pycaret 2.0.

title: Prediction with Saved Model Attribute Error
body:
Hello,

I have an issue when trying to re use my saved regression Model.
I have been able to create use and save my model within the same session. 
However after i stop my session and want to load previously save model and make new prediction as per the Tutorial. 
I am loading the Model succesfully but after typing the cmd "predict_model" I'm getting an an "Attribute error"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36540215/91018996-edbbb600-e622-11ea-85dd-00e2665549ce.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36540215/91019106-10e66580-e623-11ea-956f-a8133b14efb4.png)

I am getting this error on the computer i have develop the model in and the sample of data i m doing the prediction have the same frame/attributes only the size changed compare the previous prediction done successfully.


Here is my pip and pd version 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36540215/91020133-a9c9b080-e624-11ea-8e7e-a5612b3c9149.png)

Thanks for your help!

title: Tune Model Never Completes
body:
Hi all,

I'm enjoying PyCaret quite a bit so far. However, when I attempt to tune a model of any size (say 5 million rows), the tune model stop simply never progresses, it begins, gives the initial output and then never changes. I let it run for over 8 hours last night with no progress.

The model I'm attempting to tune is a GPU accelerated xgboost ('xgboost', tree_method = 'gpu_hist', gpu_id = 0). Training the model takes under 30 seconds even with 5 million rows. Chaging the model to not use GPU doesn't appear to make a difference.

I have seen it finish once, but it was with many fewer rows, (say around 200K). I'm simply running "tuned_xgb = tune_model(xgb, optimize='Precision')".

Any thoughts?

Thanks!

title: Possible bug: test_size in train_test_split when sampling=True
body:
In function `setup` of `regression.py` and `classification.py`, when `sampling is True and data.shape[0] > 25000`, sampling and the train/test split proceeds as follows:

```
X_, X__, y_, y__ = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=1-i, stratify=y, random_state=seed, shuffle=data_split_shuffle)
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_, y_, test_size=0.3, stratify=y_, random_state=seed, shuffle=data_split_shuffle)
```

My question is whether or not `test_size` in the second line should be hardcoded to 0.3 or whether it should be `test_size = 1-train_size`, where `train_size` is the user-specified parameter in `setup`.

body:

title: AttributeError in plot_model for 2D Cluster PCA Plot
body:
For a clustering model I've been working on with pycaret pre-2.0, I was generating the PCA plot successfully. I updated to 2.0, and receive the error below when running plot_model(<my_model>, plot='cluster').  The other plot types, e.g., 'elbow', generate a plot output without an error. Does the error below suggest I would have a feature format issue in my dataset?

```
~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pycaret/clustering.py in plot_model(model, plot, feature, label, save, system)
   3416 
   3417         for i in pca_.Cluster:
-> 3418             a = int(i.split()[1])
   3419             clus_num.append(a)
   3420 

AttributeError: 'float' object has no attribute 'split'
```

title: Getting an error while running the topic modeling
body:
Hi pycaret team,
when I was using setup for topic modeling it's giving me an error

PFA

![Screenshot (233)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40235632/86212473-c2be6400-bb95-11ea-917d-41352e33b4c3.png)
![Screenshot (234)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40235632/86212485-c94cdb80-bb95-11ea-9c70-46518dde8748.png)

but I was able to fix it in scratch,just by increasing the max_length of the text.
but I don't know how to fix it in pycaret.

I used this code to fix it on scratch.

nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_sm", disable=['parser', 'ner'])
nlp.max_length = 3000000

title: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'flush' outside notebook
body:
Does pycaret support usage outside of notebooks utilizing IPython?

I am trying to deploy models in production (outside of Jupiter notebooks) by loading models that I saved from a notebook but I get errors related to IPython. The model loads properly but fails on predict_model due to clear_output() on line 6636.

title: Clustering plot_model changing the index of the dataset
body:
I found an issue when executing the function:
def plot_model(model, plot='cluster', feature = None, label = False)

This line is changing the index of the dataset and wrongly assigns the cluster label:
[line 2528] b.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)

If you remove the line, the plot shows correctly the cluster label for each row.

title: display undefined in datasets.py
body:
Hi,

I am using pycaret in rstudio.

```
from IPython.display import display
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import pycaret
from pycaret.datasets import get_data

dataset = get_data('credit')
```

Returns this error:
```
NameError: name 'display' is not defined

Detailed traceback: 
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\Users\herma\AppData\Local\conda\conda\envs\r-reticulate\lib\site-packages\pycaret\datasets.py", line 77, in get_data
    display(data.head())
```
Need to include `import IPython`

Herman

title: setup() in clustering doesn't support passing silent=True
body:
from pycaret.clustering import *
data_setup = setup(df, normalize = True, silent=True, session_id = 42,verbose=False)

`_TypeError: setup() got an unexpected keyword argument 'silent'_`

title: NameError: name 'display_id' is not defined when executing code in IDE

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
Hi there, 

I just got this error while coding execution in Visual Studio Code.

`NameError: name 'display_id' is not defined`

And here is code tried:

```
from sklearn.datasets import load_boston
import pandas as pd
from pycaret import regression

boston = load_boston()

df = pd.DataFrame(data=boston["data"], columns=boston["feature_names"])
df["MEDV"] = boston["target"]

exp_reg = regression.setup(
    data=df,
    target="MEDV",
    train_size=0.7,
    normalize=True,
    remove_outliers=True
)

model = regression.create_model(estimator='lr')
```

Is there somehow to check if user is executing code either in prompt, IDE or Jupyter Notebook/Google Colab? 

How can I contribute to solve this problem?

For this specific case, I just comment 5 lines and it worked. 

```
1689 # if verbose:
1690 #     display_ = display(master_display, display_id=True)
1691 #     display_id = display_.display_id
...
2015 # if verbose:
2016 #     update_display(master_display, display_id = display_id)
```

Thanks!

  File "/Users/xxx/projects/python/pycaret/test.py", line 15, in <module>
    compare_models()
  File "/Users/xxx/projects/python/pycaret/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pycaret/classification.py", line 3185, in compare_models
    display_id = display_.display_id
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'display_id'
`


running on python 3.7.7 macos

Anyone could help?

title: Could not convert STR column to FLOAT when this column has missing values
body:
I load a dataset (8000,22) with a string column contains float numbers. So the setup() function infer that this column is categorical because this column contains whitespace characters. 
So when i force the setup() function with the parameter numeric_features set to with this column 

I encountered this error : ValueError: could not convert string to float 

When i debug the code i see that in the script preprocess.py you use the function .astype(float64) for conversion. I think you should use the pandas function to_numeric() with the parameter errors set to 'coerce' and the parameter downcast to 'integer'  or 'float or whatever. This function with theses settings will convert any columns in numeric and will force the unrecognized values to NaN.

title: PyCaret is unable to scale for large datasets
body:

Here's the Kaggle link:
https://www.kaggle.com/c/pubg-finish-placement-prediction/data

I tried to run my scripts on Google Colab using GPU/TPU but I am facing similar issues. It crashes after confirming the feature types. 

Is this supposed to happen for large datasets. If yes, how do I rectify it?

P.S. Thank you for this awesome library! I love using it!
